page.title: 19THE S.W.R.I.
page.content: As no hall was available in the village when it was decided to form a Woman's Rural Institute in 1918,the local ladies of that time decided to join the Braco ladies,and to this day, it is called Braco& Greenloaning W.R.I Meetings are held in the village hall on the third Thursday of each month between Sept. & April, with an outing in May. 12 ladies from Greenloaning travel to Braco to attend the meetings & enjoy the many activities offered. Cookery,floral art,dressmaking and other crafts are demonstrated,debates, travel talks & slides shown. Teenagers are welcomed and the Young Farmers Club is invited to participate at one meeting in the syllabus.Monthly competitions are held for needlework, baking etc. Meetings are enjoyable and lively, concluding with a cup of tea & scones & pancakes baked by a member.
